alue","type":"uint256"}],"name":"decreaseAllowance","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"spender","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"addedValue","type":"uint256"}],"name":"increaseAllowance","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"isOwner","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"owner","outputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[],"name":"renounceOwnership","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address payable","name":"newContract","type":"address"}],"name":"setFundManager","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"totalSupply","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"recipient","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transfer","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"sender","type":"address"},{"internalType":"address","name":"recipient","type":"address"},{"internalType":"uint256","name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"transferFrom","outputs":[{"internalType":"bool","name":"","type":"bool"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Implementation of the {IERC20} interface modified to suit the Rari Fund Token (RFT).  * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using {_mint}. For a generic mechanism see {ERC20Mintable}.  * TIP: For a detailed writeup see our guide https://forum.zeppelin.solutions/t/how-to-implement-erc20-supply-mechanisms/226[How to implement supply mechanisms].  * We have followed general OpenZeppelin guidelines: functions revert instead of returning `false` on failure. This behavior is nonetheless conventional and does not conflict with the expectations of ERC20 applications.  * Additionally, an {Approval} event is emitted on calls to {transferFrom}. This allows applications to reconstruct the allowance for all accounts just by listening to said events. Other implementations of the EIP may not emit these events, as it isn't required by the specification.  * Finally, the non-standard {decreaseAllowance} and {increaseAllowance} functions have been added to mitigate the well-known issues around setting allowances. See {IERC20-approve}.","methods":{"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.      * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.      * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setFundManager(address)":{"details":"Sets or upgrades the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken.","params":{"newContract":"The address of the new RariFundManager contract."}},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}.      * Requirements:      * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};      * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/rft/ERC20.sol":"ERC20"},"evmVersion":"istanbul","libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/RariFundController.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa0fa45dac7d1154851819bcd5b7d7047f2eff8cb6074f28823e7cf2fe01151fa","urls":["bzz-raw://e7ff2969dc07bdd1aded82b6c149df6ee6374dfd221e1812b3c7868d13660cf9","dweb:/ipfs/QmfYPGWGWFs3GewnuGGYsZcKGonb3Km2LchfeMuVDAb139"]},"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/RariFundManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9765fbc65548fc8dd2efcf5e15794cd8a34c6360e80d1c0f43729e1817c78a7a","urls":["bzz-raw://056ef32fc66e9b80c215288d1e6cb87d1cfdc5f72be7eb96f61b5f4ebe6e30b0","dweb:/ipfs/QmVZ1PE8FDJopPnsXFAVb6s4zUfTqaU8oDLa7w8bxcHpvF"]},"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/RariFundProxy.sol":{"keccak256":"0x463e4136b905e9c98022d5ff86abbd0b6788c60575a6865f8acd1525fabebb8b","urls":["bzz-raw://10d5b531f936128a5bc80f04ec55518242d69906d04bae5314d04c1428485171","dweb:/ipfs/QmXnubqJiiYr63L4tVAe9RDPD89e2Ce5Bhcg53a6zYbT2C"]},"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/RariFundToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x556f8d56f9d7c5e427344f0cbd15291dffa1b547583a6ee5d744ae07f89e2e1f","urls":["bzz-raw://8dd1516d4f9af42ef48bdc92c29d22f57ec891bc9cd34c32db98f6c27f3aa222","dweb:/ipfs/QmeaoCBSjUvqGcqUjwCAZU6NecvSBfgf1tHGBBDtBXxTqN"]},"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/external/aave/AToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0066a510edb8075e009b558d0797c88e41dd979620532ff0ad9eea11d2d27280","urls":["bzz-raw://d992f3111d391394cf17a057cdb1a79451c60b5c528b5d84e2b1fc4e025d6b3e","dweb:/ipfs/QmWm7YMYsWKFPk4RnM89zuCPekHUuSZcmHP6Ue4skb7Vyk"]},"/home/david/rari-contracts-v2.0.0/contracts/external/aave/LendingPool.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3214e168ba46042ffc27745ae74ea19b2d16989585889c47e0c1e2764ce8d05b","urls":["bzz-raw://5ed61d0a941f7d0b6a8afb6beb170a9df5282484afaea583748be3349748235d","dweb:/ipfs/QmR9jgxcbBQShDyx5LCE nodes.documentation:
@dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface modified to suit the Rari Fund Token (RFT).

 * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means
that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using {_mint}.
For a generic mechanism see {ERC20Mintable}.

 * TIP: For a detailed writeup see our guide
https://forum.zeppelin.solutions/t/how-to-implement-erc20-supply-mechanisms/226[How
to implement supply mechanisms].

 * We have followed general OpenZeppelin guidelines: functions revert instead
of returning `false` on failure. This behavior is nonetheless conventional
and does not conflict with the expectations of ERC20 applications.

 * Additionally, an {Approval} event is emitted on calls to {transferFrom}.
This allows applications to reconstruct the allowance for all accounts just
by listening to said events. Other implementations of the EIP may not emit
these events, as it isn't required by the specification.

 * Finally, the non-standard {decreaseAllowance} and {increaseAllowance}
functions have been added to mitigate the well-known issues around setting
allowances. See {IERC20-approve}.
nodes.name: ERC20

nodes.documentation: @dev See {IERC20-totalSupply}.
nodes.name: totalSupply

nodes.documentation: @dev See {IERC20-balanceOf}.
nodes.name: balanceOf

nodes.documentation:
@dev See {IERC20-transfer}.

     * Requirements:

     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation: @dev See {IERC20-allowance}.
nodes.name: allowance
approve

arguments.value: ERC20: transfer amount exceeds allowance

nodes.documentation:
@dev See {IERC20-transferFrom}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not
required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};

     * Requirements:
- `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.
- the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least
`amount`.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.

     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {IERC20-approve}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.

     * Requirements:

     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: increaseAllowance

arguments.value: ERC20: decreased allowance below zero

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.

     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {IERC20-approve}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.

     * Requirements:

     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least
`subtractedValue`.
nodes.name: decreaseAllowance

nodes.documentation: @dev Emitted when the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken is set.
nodes.name: FundManagerSet

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets or upgrades the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken.
@param newContract The address of the new RariFundManager contract.
nodes.name: setFundManager

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: transfer from the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: transfer from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: transfer from the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: transfer to the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: transfer to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: transfer to the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: transfer amount exceeds balance

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract."

arguments.value: Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract."

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves tokens `amount` from `sender` to `recipient`.

     * This is internal function is equivalent to {transfer}, and can be used to
e.g. implement automatic token fees, slashing mechanisms, etc.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event.

     * Requirements:

     * - `sender` cannot be the zero address.
- `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.
nodes.name: _transfer

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: mint to the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: mint to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: mint to the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
the total supply.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.

     * Requirements

     * - `to` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _mint

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: burn from the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: burn from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: burn from the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: burn amount exceeds balance

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract."

arguments.value: Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Fund manager contract not set. This may be due to an upgrade of this token contract."

nodes.documentation:
@dev Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, reducing the
total supply.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `to` set to the zero address.

     * Requirements

     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.
- `account` must have at least `amount` tokens.
nodes.name: _burn

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: approve from the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: approve from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: approve from the zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: approve to the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: approve to the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: approve to the zero address"

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the `owner`s tokens.

     * This is internal function is equivalent to `approve`, and can be used to
e.g. set automatic allowances for certain subsystems, etc.

     * Emits an {Approval} event.

     * Requirements:

     * - `owner` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _approve

arguments.value: ERC20: burn amount exceeds allowance

nodes.name: _burnFrom

@dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface modified to suit the Rari Fund Token (RFT).

 * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means
that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using {_mint}.
For a generic mechanism see {ERC20Mintable}.

 * TIP: For a detailed writeup see our guide
https://forum.zeppelin.solutions/t/how-to-implement-erc20-supply-mechanisms/226[How
to implement supply mechanisms].

 * We have followed general OpenZeppelin guidelines: functions revert instead
of returning `false` on failure. This behavior is nonetheless conventional
and does not conflict with the expectations of ERC20 applications.

 * Additionally, an {Approval} event is emitted on calls to {transferFrom}.
This allows applications to reconstruct the allowance for all accounts just
by listening to said events. Other implementations of the EIP may not emit
these events, as it isn't required by the specification.

 * Finally, the non-standard {decreaseAllowance} and {increaseAllowance}
functions have been added to mitigate the well-known issues around setting
allowances. See {IERC20-approve}.

@dev See {IERC20-transfer}.

     * Requirements:

     * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation: @dev See {IERC20-allowance}.
nodes.name: allowance
approve

arguments.value: ERC20: transfer amount exceeds allowance

nodes.documentation:
@dev See {IERC20-transferFrom}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not
required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};

     * Requirements:
- `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.
- the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least
`amount`.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.

     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {IERC20-approve}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.

     * Requirements:

     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: increaseAllowance

arguments.value: ERC20: decreased allowance below zero

nodes.documentation:
@dev Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.

     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for
problems described in {IERC20-approve}.

     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.

     * Requirements:

     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least
`subtractedValue`.
nodes.name: decreaseAllowance

nodes.documentation: @dev Emitted when the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken is set.
nodes.name: FundManagerSet

@dev Sets or upgrades the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken.
@param newContract The address of the new RariFundManager contract.
nodes.name: setFundManager

nodes.documentation:
@dev Moves tokens `amount` from `sender` to `recipient`.

     * This is internal function is equivalent to {transfer}, and can be used to
e.g. implement automatic token fees, slashing mechanisms, etc.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event.

     * Requirements:

     * - `sender` cannot be the zero address.
- `recipient` cannot be the zero address.
- `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
the total supply.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.

     * Requirements

     * - `to` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _mint

nodes.documentation:
@dev Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, reducing the
total supply.

     * Emits a {Transfer} event with `to` set to the zero address.

     * Requirements

     * - `account` cannot be the zero address.
- `account` must have at least `amount` tokens.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the `owner`s tokens.

     * This is internal function is equivalent to `approve`, and can be used to
e.g. set automatic allowances for certain subsystems, etc.

     * Emits an {Approval} event.

     * Requirements:

     * - `owner` cannot be the zero address.
- `spender` cannot be the zero address.
nodes.name: _approve

arguments.value: ERC20: burn amount exceeds allowance

nodes.name: _burnFrom

devdoc.details: Implementation of the {IERC20} interface modified to suit the Rari Fund Token (RFT).  * This implementation is agnostic to the way tokens are created. This means that a supply mechanism has to be added in a derived contract using {_mint}. For a generic mechanism see {ERC20Mintable}.  * TIP: For a detailed writeup see our guide https://forum.zeppelin.solutions/t/how-to-implement-erc20-supply-mechanisms/226[How to implement supply mechanisms].  * We have followed general OpenZeppelin guidelines: functions revert instead of returning `false` on failure. This behavior is nonetheless conventional and does not conflict with the expectations of ERC20 applications.  * Additionally, an {Approval} event is emitted on calls to {transferFrom}. This allows applications to reconstruct the allowance for all accounts just by listening to said events. Other implementations of the EIP may not emit these events, as it isn't required by the specification.  * Finally, the non-standard {decreaseAllowance} and {increaseAllowance} functions have been added to mitigate the well-known issues around setting allowances. See {IERC20-approve}.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.      * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.      * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.      * Requirements:      * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setFundManager(address).details: Sets or upgrades the RariFundManager of the RariFundToken.

params.newContract: The address of the new RariFundManager contract.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}.      * Requirements:      * - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}.      * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20};      * Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for `sender`'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
